column4: argh, the ubuntu bugzilla-password mailer trips my spam controls (and mail doesn't get delivered..)
need to get a better spam filter
try spamassassin, i've never has a false positive with it
I use spamassassin, on postfix.. but it rejects unknown sender domains... and host bugzilla.warthogs.hbd.com does not exist (or the nameserver timeouts)
weird, it didn't use that domain to send to me. they must be changing the setup
you get the bugzilla thing worked out? i checked my password email, and its coming from bugzilla-daemon@bugzilla.ubuntu.com
it works now
but you have to look at the Return-Path
which looks broken ..
anyway, I've relaxed my postfix checks a bit
for me, when i select one, it puts a check mark in the box
or are you talking about something different?
yes, but you'll need the gstreamer plugin then
why not? ffmpeg itself is free..
it does? how?
if I replace sftp:// by ssh:// the links on my desktop suddenly work, and I can still transfer files..
sftp:// works fine for me. in fact, if you use the Connect to Server... GUI and select SSH, it uses sftp://
yes, that's the strange thing..
I can connect to server, everything works fine
then I log out, log back in, click the connection link that's on my desktop
then it errors on me
replacing sftp:// by ssh:// using gconf-editor makes the link work again
no, this is a known problem
oh ok
